title: Ticket #4621: Help CMS use a very small condor_shadow_s
description:
CMS has started to use the condor_shadow_s on its pools. In 8.3.1, this shrinks the per-shadow RAM usage to 640kb. We can do better:
  • krb5 is not used and (looking at the smaps, could be a big consumer of RAM).
  • The 32-bit shadow_s would be much smaller than the 64-bit one.

So, here's an idea:

  • Remove KRB5 linkage from condor_shadow_s daemon. If you need to use KRB5, then you're stuck with condor_shadow.
  • Move condor_master_s from condor-static-shadow to the base condor RPM.
    • I do not believe we can mix the 32-bit condor_master with the 64-bit condor_procd without further work. Binary datastructs (such as struct ProcFamilyUsage, which differs in size between the 32-bit and 64-bit build) are in the procd protocol and written directly across the Unix socket.
  • Do not ship the 64-bit condor-static-shadow RPM.
  • Place the 32-bit condor-static-shadow RPM in the 64-bit release repo.

This would allow us to cleanly install the 32-bit static via puppet using RPMs. All the other mechanisms so far require hackery of the RPM DB or installing from tarballs.
